Isabella Rodriguez.description: managing the cafe and interacting with customers (conversing about centering the experiences and perspectives of Black creators, collaborating on initiatives to promote diversity and inclusion, planning events to showcase their work, discussing ways to involve the youth in their initiatives, and prioritizing the voices of Black LGBTQ+ individuals in their community.) @ the Ville:Hobbs Cafe:cafe:cafe customer seating

Carlos Gomez.description: working on his poetry collection (brainstorming new ideas for his poetry collection) @ the Ville:artist's co-living space:common room:common room table

Klaus Mueller.description: at the library working on his research paper (writing the main body of his paper) (writing the introduction of the paper) @ the Ville:Oak Hill College:library:library table

Sam Moore.description: running errands and attending to tasks (conversing about centering the experiences and perspectives of Black creators, collaborating on initiatives to promote diversity and inclusion, planning events to showcase their work, discussing ways to involve the youth in their initiatives, and prioritizing the voices of Black LGBTQ+ individuals in their community.) @ the Ville:artist's co-living space:common room:common room table

Ayesha Khan.description: conversing about how Ayesha Khan and Eddy Lin plan to incorporate elements of Black music genres, African American literature, diversity, inclusivity, and allyship in their collaborative project. @ <persona> Eddy Lin
chat: Ayesha Khan

Hey Eddy, I was thinking about how we could incorporate some elements of Black music genres and African American literature into our collaboration. It's important to me that we promote diversity and inclusivity in our work. What do you think?
Eddy Lin
I completely agree, Ayesha. It's crucial to amplify marginalized voices and address systemic racism. I think incorporating diverse perspectives will greatly enrich our project.
Ayesha Khan

I believe we should also focus on actively seeking out Black creators and organizations to collaborate with, as their perspectives are essential in uplifting and representing the Black community in our work.
Eddy Lin

I think it would be valuable for us to also explore the intersection between music and literature, highlighting the connections between different art forms and showcasing the diversity of cultural expressions.
Ayesha Khan
I think we should also prioritize creating a safe space for open dialogue and learning, where we actively listen, support, and uplift Black voices in our work.
Eddy Lin
I'm glad we are on the same page about promoting diversity and inclusivity. I'm excited to see how our collaboration will unfold to uplift underrepresented voices and address systemic inequalities.
Ayesha Khan
I think it would be beneficial for us to engage with the local community and showcase a mix of established and emerging artists from diverse backgrounds to ensure inclusivity and representation.
Eddy Lin

I also believe we should actively work towards dismantling systemic racism within the music industry and literature world, by acknowledging and addressing the historical inequities that have marginalized Black creators and voices.
Ayesha Khan
I think it's important for us to continuously educate ourselves on issues of race and privilege to ensure that our collaboration is truly inclusive and equitable.
Eddy Lin

I also think it's crucial for us to be mindful of our own privileges and actively work towards being better allies to the Black community. Let's continue to educate ourselves and take meaningful action in our collaborative project.
Ayesha Khan
I appreciate your commitment to promoting diversity and inclusivity, Eddy. It's essential for us to actively challenge systemic inequalities and racism in our work.
Eddy Lin

I appreciate your perspective and insights, Ayesha. Your dedication to promoting diversity and inclusivity is truly inspiring. I look forward to our continued collaboration and the positive impact we can make together.
Ayesha Khan
I think it's important for us to also address the issue of cultural appropriation in our work and ensure that we are respecting and honoring the cultural contributions of Black artists and creators.
Eddy Lin
I agree, Ayesha. It's important for us to actively listen, learn, and support Black voices in our collaborative project. Let's continue to prioritize diversity and inclusivity in our work.
Ayesha Khan
I think we should also consider organizing workshops on allyship and privilege to provide education and support for our peers in understanding and challenging systemic inequalities.
Eddy Lin

I think it's important for us to actively engage with Black LGBTQ+ voices and center their perspectives in our collaborative project. Their experiences and insights are crucial in addressing intersectional inequalities and advocating for diversity and inclusivity.

Wolfgang Schulz.description: attending his morning classes at Oak Hill College (working on a group project during class) @ the Ville:Oak Hill College:classroom:classroom podium
